events.originalText: Russian invasion of Ukraine: Russian forces captured the city of Sievierodonetsk, Ukraine, after six weeks of fighting.
events.subtitle: Russian invasion of Ukraine
events.headline: Russian forces capture Sievierodonetsk, Ukraine after six weeks of fighting

events.originalText: In response to a Freedom of Information Act request, the CIA acknowledged the existence of Area 51, a secretive U.S. Air Force facility in Nevada and a subject of various UFO, and other, conspiracy theories.
events.subtitle: Freedom of Information Act (United States)
events.headline: CIA acknowledges existence of Area 51 in Nevada

events.originalText: Singer Michael Jackson (pictured) died as a result of the combination of drugs in his body.
events.subtitle: Michael Jackson
events.headline: Michael Jackson dies from drug combination

events.originalText: The rainbow flag (original version pictured) representing gay pride was first flown at the San Francisco Gay Freedom Day parade.
events.subtitle: Rainbow flag (LGBT)
events.headline: Rainbow flag first flown at San Francisco Gay Freedom Day parade

events.originalText: More than an estimated 400 million people viewed Our World, the first live international satellite television production.
events.subtitle: Our World (1967 TV program)
events.headline: Over 400 million people view first live international satellite TV production

events.originalText: Two cryptographers working for the U.S. National Security Agency left on vacation to Mexico, and proceeded to defect to the Soviet Union.
events.subtitle: Cryptography
events.headline: Two NSA cryptographers defect to Soviet Union while on vacation in Mexico

events.originalText: The Korean War began with North Korean forces launching a pre-dawn raid over the 38th parallel into South Korea.
events.subtitle: Korean War
events.headline: Korean War begins with North Korean forces crossing 38th parallel

events.originalText: The United Nations Security Council passed Resolution 82 condemning the North Korean invasion of South Korea.
events.subtitle: United Nations Security Council
events.headline: UN Security Council condemns North Korean invasion with Resolution 82

events.originalText: World War II: U.S. Navy and Royal Navy ships bombarded Cherbourg, France, to support U.S. Army units engaged in the Battle of Cherbourg.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: US and Royal Navy ships bombard Cherbourg in support of Battle of Cherbourg

events.originalText: Second World War: Operation Aerial, an evacuation of nearly 200,000 Allied soldiers from French ports, was completed.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Operation Aerial evacuates nearly 200,000 Allied soldiers from French ports

events.originalText: The United States Congress passed the Mann Act, which prohibited the interstate transport of females for "immoral purposes".
events.subtitle: United States Congress
events.headline: US Congress passes Mann Act prohibiting interstate transport of females for 'immoral purposes'

events.originalText: Anglo-Spanish War: The largest battle ever fought on Jamaica, the three-day Battle of Rio Nuevo, began.
events.subtitle: Anglo-Spanish War (1654–1660)
events.headline: Anglo-Spanish War: Battle of Rio Nuevo begins on Jamaica
